page.title: 13The Seafront Penarth.
page.content: The seafront's most popular feature is the pier, from which it is possible to enjoy views across the Bristol Channel as well as the islands of{Steepholm} and{Flatholm.}During the summer months there are regular steamer trips aboard the Waverley to Ilfracombe or Lundy Island. Sailing,fishing and water ski- ing are favourite pastimes for many people. Others prefer to stroll along the Esplanade, which backs the pebble beach, and extends from the amusement arcare to the Yacht Club. The Italian Gardens, a sheltered suntrap facing the Esplanade, are attractive with their palm trees and flowerbeds. Along the front there are several well know resturants, the old Public Baths which have recently been closed and the ruin of the once grand Esplanade Hotel destroyed by fire some years ago which is soon to be demolished.
